options.text: A base of three rings made of 17 carbon atoms arranged in three hexagons and one pentagon.

title: Axolotls are masters of regeneration

options.text: Because the Spanish did not have enough resources to support the axolotl population

title: How to spot a liar - Pamela Meyer

multiple-choice.question: What is the core proposition that liespotters accept?

options.label: A
options.text: Reversing the order of the story

options.label: D
options.text: The increasing complexity of human behavior

options.label: A
options.text: It helps to detect deception more easily

options.label: B
options.text: It helps to build trust with others

options.label: C
options.text: It helps to exempt oneself from collaborating in a lie

options.label: A
options.text: To signal to others that we value honesty is important

options.label: B
options.text: To create a sense of community

options.label: C
options.text: To exempt ourselves from collaborating in a lie

options.label: D
options.text: To make it easier to detect deception

options.label: A

options.label: B
options.text: A fake smile is more asymmetrical than a genuine smile

options.label: C
options.text: A fake smile is associated with contempt, while a genuine smile is associated with happiness

options.label: D

title: How fast can a vaccine be made? - Dan Kwartler

multiple-choice.question: What is the average time it takes to develop a vaccine under regular circumstances?
Which stage of vaccine development is the most flexible?

options.label: A
options.text: To evaluate the safety and efficacy of a vaccine

options.label: B
options.text: To find a safe way to introduce the immune system to a virus or bacteria

options.label: C
options.text: To determine the right dosage and delivery schedule

options.label: D
options.text: To identify rare side effects and negative reactions

options.label: A
options.text: They are the fastest to produce

options.label: C
options.text: They rely on weakened viral strains that must be cultivated in non-human tissue over long periods of time

options.label: D
options.text: They are the most expensive to produce

options.label: A
options.text: To determine the right dosage and delivery schedule

options.label: B
options.text: To identify rare side effects and negative reactions

options.label: C
options.text: To determine safety across the vaccine's primary use population

options.label: D
options.text: To evaluate the safety and efficacy of a vaccine

multiple-choice.question: What is a strategy used to speed up clinical testing in extreme circumstances?

options.label: A
options.text: Running multiple trials within one phase at the same time

multiple-choice.question: What is a characteristic of DNA and mRNA based vaccines?

options.label: A
options.text: They rely on weakened viral strains that must be cultivated in non-human tissue over long periods of time

options.label: C
options.text: They can dramatically expedite all three stages of vaccine production

options.label: D
options.text: They are the most expensive to produce

multiple-choice.question: What is the best strategy for labs around the world to cooperate and work in parallel on different approaches to vaccine development?

options.label: B
options.text: To divide and conquer any pathogen

multiple-choice.question: What is the primary goal of vaccine development?

options.label: A
options.text: To create a vaccine that is widely available and affordable

options.label: B
options.text: To create a vaccine that can be used to treat any disease

options.label: C
options.text: To create a vaccine that is safe and effective

options.label: D
options.text: To create a vaccine that can be produced quickly

multiple-choice.question: What is the result of a successful Phase III trial in clinical testing?

options.label: A
options.text: The vaccine is rejected for further testing

options.label: B
options.text: The vaccine is approved for public use

options.label: C
options.text: The vaccine is sent back to the exploratory research stage

options.label: D
options.text: The vaccine is put on hold for further review

multiple-choice.question: What is a factor that contributes to the difficulty of speeding up clinical testing?

options.label: C
options.text: The lack of funding for research

options.text: To create a smooth animation by making the brain ignore the black spaces.

options.label: B
options.text: A pencil, a ruler, and a grown-up to help.

options.label: C
options.text: A pencil, a ruler, and a round piece of cardboard or a paper plate.

options.label: D
options.text: A pencil, a ruler, a grown-up to help, and a round piece of cardboard or a paper plate.

multiple-choice.question: What is the purpose of the black and white paper in the zoetrope?

options.label: A
options.text: To make the drawings look more colorful.

options.label: C
options.text: To make the walls of the zoetrope, which help contain the drawings and create the illusion of movement.

options.label: D
options.text: To make the cartoon look more realistic.

multiple-choice.question: What is the purpose of the white strip of paper in the zoetrope?

options.label: A
options.text: To make the drawings look more colorful.

options.label: C
options.text: To make the rectangles for each drawing, which are used to create the illusion of movement.

options.label: D
options.text: To make the cartoon look more realistic.

multiple-choice.question: What is the purpose of the rectangles in the zoetrope?

options.label: A
options.text: To make the drawings look more colorful.

options.label: C
options.text: To make the rectangles for each drawing, which are used to create the illusion of movement.

options.label: D
options.text: To make the cartoon look more realistic.

multiple-choice.question: What is the purpose of the drawings in the zoetrope?

options.label: A
options.text: To make the cartoon look more realistic.

options.label: B
options.text: To create a smooth animation by creating the illusion of movement.

options.label: C
options.text: To make the drawings look more colorful.

multiple-choice.question: What happens when the drawings move quickly in the zoetrope?

options.label: C
options.text: The brain stops noticing the blank spaces in between the drawings, creating the illusion of movement.

multiple-choice.question: What are the two illusions that happen when the drawings move quickly in the zoetrope?

options.label: A
options.text: The cartoon looks more static, and the drawings look less colorful.

options.label: B
options.text: The cartoon looks more realistic, and the drawings look more colorful.

options.label: C
options.text: The brain stops noticing the blank spaces in between the drawings, creating the illusion of movement, and the brain fills in the blanks in between the frames for you, and turns them into something that makes sense.

options.label: D
options.text: The cartoon looks more static, and the drawings look more colorful.

title: Art with Mati & Dada | Kandinsky

multiple-choice.question: Who is the artist mentioned in the transcript?
What is the connection that Vasily Kandinsky makes between music and painting?

options.label: A
options.text: Music is a source of inspiration for painting

options.label: B
options.text: Painting is a way to express emotions felt while listening to music

options.label: C
options.text: Both music and painting are forms of visual art

options.label: D
options.text: A painting can be "listened to" and is made up of different colors and sounds, just like a symphony or a song

options.label: B

options.label: C
options.text: They make up different sounds that combine to create a symphony or a song

options.label: D

options.label: D

options.label: B

options.label: C
options.text: By feeling the texture of the painting

options.label: D

title: Homophone song: There, Their, They're

multiple-choice.question: What are the words "there" and "there" in the transcript?
What does the transcript suggest to help identify the correct usage of the words "there" and "there"?
What does the transcript mean by "drop the a"?

options.label: A
options.text: Remove the letter "a" from the word

options.label: B
options.text: Use the word without the letter "a"

options.label: C
options.text: Combine the words "are" and "I" to form a contraction

options.label: D
options.text: Change the word to a different spelling

multiple-choice.question: According to the transcript, what is the purpose of an apostrophe?

options.label: C
options.text: To show the location of a place

multiple-choice.question: What is the name of the song mentioned in the transcript?

options.label: C
options.text: A fun way to learn grammar

options.label: D
options.text: The use of music in education

options.label: B

options.label: C
options.text: By practicing writing sentences with homophones

options.label: A

options.label: A

options.label: B
options.text: One is a place and the other is a thing

options.label: C
options.text: One is a place and the other is a location

options.label: D
options.text: One is a place and the other is an action
